title: Potential energy - calculating force from energy

content.question: A conservative force <math alttext="F sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math> exerted on an object gives the object potential energy <math alttext="U of x equals, a times x squared, plus b x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>U</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>x</mi></math>, where <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> is the position of the object in meters, <math alttext="a equals 1 joule per square meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>J/m</mtext><mtext>2</mtext></msup></math>, and <math alttext="b equals 2 joules per meter" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>J/m</mtext></math>. What is the magnitude of <math alttext="F sub C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mtext>C</mtext></msub></math> when the object is at position <math alttext="x equals 2 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="4 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>
<math alttext="6 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>
<math alttext="the fraction 20 over 3, end fraction, newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>20</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>
<math alttext="8 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="6 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
